pullRequest.body:
This PR renames `OplaxNatTrans` to `OplaxTrans` and puts it in the `Oplax` namespace (as there should also be oplax natural transformations between lax functors, so this is more fitting).

It also removes `@[simp]` from `OplaxTrans.id` and `OplaxTrans.vcomp`, and instead adds `@[simp!]` to the `CategoryStruct` instance. This is needed as for example, right now, in order to prove that `(Î· â‰« Î¸).app a = Î·.app a â‰« Î¸.app a` simp needs to first convert this to `(OplaxTrans.vcomp Î· Î¸).app a` which is not ideal (in particular it converts `(Î· â‰« Î¸)` to `OplaxTrans.vcomp Î· Î¸`).

This is part of some of the restructuring that I want to do before constructing the bicategory of pseudofunctors.

---

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#18250~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
It seems like deprecated aliases for the renamed declarations are missing?

Why not just `Oplax.Trans`?
```suggestion
structure Trans (F G : OplaxFunctor B C) where
```
Because there should be three transformations between oplax functors (oplax transformations, lax transformations and strong transformations) if I have understood correctly
So `Oplax.OplaxTrans` should indicate that this is an oplax transformation between oplax functors (so later I can also have `Lax.OplaxTrans` and `Oplax.LaxTrans`).
Ok, so we are going to have about 9 types of transformations between lax/oplax/pseudofunctors?!

In theory yes, but I just want to have `Oplax.OplaxTrans` and `Pseudofunctor.StrongTrans` for now. I do not know in what situation one needs these other transformations, but in case someone wants to define them, I want to set the library up so that this is not too painful (perhaps if someone wishes to do that, some sort of automation could be a good idea).

pullRequest.title: feat(Bicategory/Oplax): Fix simp lemmas and renaming
